CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 16, 1961, pg. 2, reads: "Home of Bishop Harris - This impressive brick home at 7122 Campania St. is the residence of Bishop D. H. Harris, head of the Triumph the Church and Kingdom of God in Christ. Reputed to be a wealthy and shrewd businessman, the Bishop has set up plans for several hundred homes for aged and needy individuals. - Harris Photos."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "Bishop D. Harris Explains Program?  Editor's note: While Pittsburgh (The Renaissance City) proudly displays its renovation of the Golden Triangle, highlights by the $22 million Civic Arena, to its many citizens and visitors, and maps magnificent plans for 'urban renewal, it has 'swept under the rug its 'dregs of human misery' - those displaced persons, a majority of whom are Negroes, who either have not been relocated or are unable to find suitable housing on their own.  Crack Courier reporter Phyl Garland has gone behind the scenes to interview and write about these 'Prisoners of the Ghetto' and their vicious 'jailer.'  This is the fourth in a series of articles which The Courier offers its readers..."
TitMainTitle: Brick house with second story bay window, 7122 Campania Street, Lincoln Lemington
